snippet: A leaked draft of a report by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change said that climate change could reduce output and send prices higher in a period when global food demand is expected to soar.
abstract: Leaked draft of report by Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change says climate change will pose sharp risks to world's food supply in coming decades, potentially undermining crop production and driving up prices at time when demand for food is expected to soar; warning on food supply is the sharpest in tone the panel has issued, and contradicts earlier assessment that rising temperatures could have some beneficial effects on crops.
lead_paragraph: A leaked draft of a report by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change said that climate change could reduce output and send prices higher in a period when global food demand is expected to soar.

headline.main: Climate Change Seen Posing Risk to Food Supplies
headline.print_headline: Climate Change Seen Posing Risk to Food Supplies
